commands.simplyhotsprings.locationinfo.c: Click to put in chat box
commands.simplyhotsprings.biomeslist.all: All biomes known by Simply Hot Springs:
commands.simplyhotsprings.biomeslist.wit: '%s' CAN generate in the following biomes:
'%s' CANNOT generate in the following biomes:
commands.simplyhotsprings.biomeslist.mod: Hot Springs biome modifier '%s' cannot be found
commands.simplyhotsprings.biometags.clic: Click to list biomes with this tag
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.locationi: Checks your current biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the entity's current biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the biome at the position and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the given biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.biomeslis: Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs. If Hot Springs are off, it fails.
Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs that CAN generate the given kind of Hot Springs.
Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs that CANNOT generate the given kind of Hot Springs.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.biometags: Lists all biomes that are in the given biome tag.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.place.1: You can place Hot Springs with '/place feature simplyhotsprings:hot_springs_default'. If it fails to place, try standing on the ground and make sure to have solid blocks to the south-east and below you. Also, there are some configured Hot Spring examples that don't generate.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.no_world_gen: This Hot Spring is disabled in the config.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.whitelisted: This biome is whitelisted for this Hot Spring.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.blacklisted: This biome is blacklisted for this Hot Spring.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.not_whitelis: This biome is not whitelisted for this Hot Spring.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.not_blacklis: This biome is not blacklisted for this Hot Spring.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.no_hot_sprin: No Hot Springs have been added to biomes!
simplyhotsprings.config.createsSources.t: If true, Hot Spring Water makes infinite water sources, like vanilla water does.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffect.too: The namespaced effect that Hot Spring Water applies to entities. If the given effect isn't found (or left blank), no effect is applied.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectTime: The duration of the effect, in ticks. 20 ticks = 1 second.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectAmpl: The amplifier of the effect. 0 is level 1.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.tooltip: Some of these settings require any open world to be closed and reopened.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.info.to:
By default, Hot Springs only generate in biomes that are not in the "simplyhotsprings:hot_springs_blacklist" biome tag. 
The command "/simplyhotsprings" has a few subcommands that will help you test your Hot Springs. To see how to use "/simplyhotsprings", run the command "/simplyhotsprings help". 
For more useful information, visit the wiki at https://github.com/connor135246/Simply-Hot-Springs/wiki 
(Also, this config setting does nothing, so put whatever you want in here.)
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.worldGe:
Controls whether "default" Hot Springs generate. 
These are the normal Hot Springs. They look just like vanilla's pre-1.18 water lakes. They generate on the surface in most biomes and are somewhat rare. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

Controls whether "big" Hot Springs generate. 
These look like the normal Hot Springs, but are much wider and deeper. They're also rarer than normal Hot Springs. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

Controls whether "wellspring" and "big_wellspring" Hot Springs generate. 
Wellsprings are geysers of Hot Spring Water that flow out of the ground. Follow them underground to find large pockets of Hot Spring Water. Big wellsprings are rarer and may have lava lakes below them. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.debug.t: When a Hot Spring generates in the world, prints the location to console.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeGr:
A list of biomes and their specific types of grass. 
By default, dirt around Hot Springs will be turned into grass. But some biomes have their own specific grass type which you need to tell Simply Hot Springs about. 
The format is "modid:biome;modid:block[states]". 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.client.alternate: If true, Hot Spring Water makes smaller, less obtrusive steam particles instead.
